name: Ashwood Cottages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little spot near the river with fantastic room with spa and all the amenities you could need for a getaway - small kitchen but who needs to cook with all the great food places to eat at in Bright and the surrounding areas - very quiet and peaceful tucked away just out of the main town - the owners were fantastic, called to see our progress and estimated arrival on the way - had the fire going for arrival so the cottage was warm and cosy on arrival at night. love to go back and spend a week there and explore the bushland and the river out back. Short 45-60 minute drive to the snowfields made for a great day trip up the snow. Look forward to our next stay in Bright at Ashwood!
reviews.title: Fleurbeax cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at 'Fleurbaix Cottage'. It was everything we were looking for: privacy, a beautiful treed location close to the river, a spacious three rooms with plenty of adequate heating when it got chilly (lovely log fire + R/C air conditioner should you need it), small but adequate cooking facilities, and best of all, a lovely sun-room to relax in and watch the plentiful bird life. We intend to return asap!
reviews.title: An Ideal Retreat
Stay at "The Haven"
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay at "The Haven". The cottage is located at the back of the block so is very secluded. While the cottage is well appointed the kitchen is small - so if you're keen on cooking meals you are short on space. The bedroom / ensuite are more spacious and the spa bath is a great feature as well as the private decking out the back looking into the bushland. John, Martin and Linda are welcoming hosts. For cyclists the cottage is only 1km from the rail trail where you can choose to go into Bright (10 minutes) or head out to Porepunkah and beyond.

My partner and I stayed in The Studio for 2 nights. Perfect location for our relaxing weekend away. The owners were friendly and welcoming, came down to say hello on arrival. The king spa is huge, with a lovely view of the bush outside. We will definitely be back on our next visit to Bright.
reviews.title: Perfect getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Fleurbaix, but the owner tells me all cottages are about the same in what they offer. All 3 cottages are different and have their own personalities. Fleurbaix was more spacious than I expected. Two sitting areas (main area & an attached sunroom), lovely big spa, shower, separate toilet, small kitchen. Surrounded by trees and shrubs for privacy. Bird feeder by the window which attracted king parrots and galahs while we were there. Tea, coffee, some milk, sweets, biscuits were provided. Cottages are at the end of a dead end street. A short drive to town (3 or 4 minutes) or 20 minutes by foot. Longer if you want to take the scenic route via the river canyon walk. (That is highly recommended). We were thrilled with this wonderful accommodation and highly recommend it to couples.
reviews.title: Peaceful & private sanctaury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent the weekend in Bright and stayed at Ashwood Cottages for 2 nights (in The Haven). It was a wonderful stay, the cottage was very well appointed, had plenty of hot water for the shower or the huge double spa bath. Beds were most comfortable and electric blankets are provided. There is a small kitchenette if you'd like to prepare a basic meal and a supply of coffee, tea, sugar, milk, biscuits are provided.
reviews.title: A great weekend in Bright

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very pleasing to meet John on arrival, he had a wealth of knowledge about the town and restaurants and gave many recommendations. Although we kept to ourselves most of the time, I am sure that the owners would not have been far away, nor hesitated to help us out if we'd needed anything. We simply had everything we needed and were left to enjoy a peaceful weekend. We will not hesitate to return again.
reviews.title: What a wonderful and perfect getaway place! 10 out of 10!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just had the most wonderful and peaceful and relaxing 4 days staying in Fleurbeax cottage in Ashwood Cottages and we can't speak more hightly of the property. John the owner and his family are the best, nothing was too much trouble for them, to putting extra ice trays in the freezer for us, to even driving us into town at night to a restaurant so we could have a drink. the most hospititable people. The property has everything you could want for. We found nothing to complain about and there was all we needed and more, lots of firewood, electric blankets, heated towel rails, amazing bird life and John gave us bird seed to feed them. Air con as well if you wish. The property backs onto the river and lovely walks are all around. Town is just over a km away. You are in amoungst all the trees and so private, you can't really see the other cottages from yours and you feel like it is you and nature. We would most definately recommend this property to everyone, to make your stay in Bright complete. A must stay. Thanks so much to John, we couldn't have wished for more.
reviews.title: Best accommodation for couples in Bright

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in The Studio cottage on a repeat visit in late July and it was just as lovely as we remembered. All of the cottages (we've had family stay in all of them) manage to be luxurious but cosy at the same time. There are lots of great little touches like chocolates and shortbreads on arrival, milk in the fridge, decent tea and plunger coffee, the coonara fireplace stocked and all ready for us to light a match and relax. There is a decent kitchen set up (hotplates, microwave, electric frying pan etc. with plenty of quality kitchenware) as well as an outdoor deck with its own BBQ.
reviews.title: The Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom in The Studio is on a mezzanine level and up a decent flight of stairs so if you prefer everything to be on the same level then the other two cottages (The Haven and Fleurbaix) would be a better choice. We loved the airiness of the mezzanine and being able to watch the tops of the trees through the windows. The whole upper 'floor' is the cottage's one bedroom and includes a huge spa bath (with a great view!) as part of the open plan, plus a shower and separate toilet.
reviews.title: "The Haven"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our third stay at Ashwood and we enjoyed The Studio just as much as the other two cottages. Great place to relax and from Ashwood it is just a short trip to the snow at Mt Buffalo. Great fire and wonderful spa were wonderful after the bushwalking in the snow. We will be back in Spring. We have stayed in many places in Australia - and usually do not keep going back to a place but we really love Ashwood Cottages and we thoroughly recommend them for every reason that you can read written on this site. Thanks to the owners for creating such peaceful and well equipped holiday accommodation - only trouble is it is so hard to leave!
reviews.title: The Studio
"Haven cottage" Beautiful, fantastic trip
reviews.text: Absolutely delighted we booked the Haven cottage at Ashwood cottages for a 3 day trip. From the first moment we arrived we felt extremely welcome by the staff and were extremely happy with the beautiful cottage. The attention to detail was exceptional (right down to a garlic crusher in the kitchen). The cottage was decorated well and had a comfy, homely feel to it. Set back in the trees, within walking distance to the river and the town, the location was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The log fire was excellent and the staff even lit it for us 30mins before we arrived.
reviews.title: Fleurbeax Cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great place to stay and would recommend to anyone heading to Bright.
reviews.title: Lovely retreat

reviews.text: Wonderful and very helpful staff.
reviews.title: Attention to detail and very comfy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent 5 night stay at Fleurbaix Cottage (1 of 3 cottages at Ashwood Cottages Bright) was blissfully peaceful and very comfortable. The airconditioning was great on the really hot days we were there. The spa was amazing after shopping and walking around Bright or taking a long drive through the mountains to Omeo and back. The cottage has a lovely glassed-in sitting room from which you can watch birds or just relax and read with a cuppa. We could walk beside the river (Canyon walk - 20 mins) from the cottage and have coffee or breakfast in Bright. The cottages are in a bush setting in a no-through road (no traffic noise).
reviews.title: Stay at Fleurbaix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hosts are very friendly but not intrusive. The Ashwood Cottage experience is one we can HIGHLY RECOMMEND to couples who want to visit Bright and also have a romantic get away.We will go back to Ashwood Cottages in autumn - want to try The Haven next time as it looks interesting on the brochure. Congratulations to the owners of Ashwood - your cottage was an excellent place to stay-thanks.
reviews.title: Pefect Anniversary Getaway

reviews.text: I gave Mum & Dad 2 nights at the Haven for their 30th Wedding Anniversary. They had such an amazing time and would have loved to stay longer! They said it was so peaceful and the surroundings were beautiful. Not far from town but very private and secluded, giving you the tranquil sense. Dad loved feeding the birds too! A very well presented getaway.
reviews.title: Peace & tranquility.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service received was absolutely fantastic, from booking the accommodation right through to the end. When they first arrived they were greeted with such a friendly manner and were made to feel very welcome. They would love to go back there again soon!
reviews.title: Ashwood Cottages - Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you so much John, Martin and Linda for making their stay such a pleasant and memorable one, and hopefully I can come and enjoy the same luxuries in the future! They loved every minute of it and would definately recommend!
reviews.title: Beautiful cosy place for a honeymoon

description: Private, secluded on 3 acres in a bushland setting on the Ovens river. For your perfect getaway you have a choice of three beautiful unique self-contained one bedroom cottages Fleurbaix ,The Studio & The Haven. Each is different in style and decor. Creature comforts include: king size beds, king size spa in bedroom, log fire, air-conditioning, heated towel rails, Free WiFi,Plasma TV, DVD Players and BBQ facilities.A short walk along the Canyon walk to restaurants & cafes .Great swimming and fishing within walking distance .Close proximity to The Rail Trail and wineries. All the cottages are "stand alone" buildings located quite a distance from each other to offer privacy and seclusion for guests.
